Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: liamgray123
Reviews.Content: Im staying in bayswater inn now and i have been for the past 2 days. After reading the previous reviews i really expected a bad hotel, which it is not. When you first come into the hotel you are greeted by very friendly staff (who also allowed us into our room early to leave our bags). We were then showed to our room shich consisted of a double bed and a single, which is more than we paid for because we only booked a double room. We had a kettle, pot mugs, sugar, spoons and milk etc, a wardrobe with coat hangers, a dressing table, 3 large mirrors, numerous towels and a PROPER bath mat. The location is a 5 minute walk from the tube station and just round the corner from a high street of shops, cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops. To be honnest theres not a wrong word i could say about the bayswater inn, and for the price we paid i was very pleased with what we got

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - OK Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater Inn ids only two blocks from the Bayswater tube stop - from there you can get anywhere in London. The rooms were small, but clean. The neighborhood is quiet and a little off the beaten path. The breakfast is OK, but the kitchen has a hard time keeping up with the food supply and the plates, silverware, etc. Generally a decent value for the price. There a couple of good pubs right in the neighborhood that are frequented by locals, which is a nice - getting to know the locals is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Messed up my booking - Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Hanan B
Reviews.Content: They messed up my booking so I had to pay an extra charge when I got to the hotel. I booked a room for 3 adults at the Bayswater Inn Hotel London. I got there to find that they had reserved me a a twin-room booking for 3 people (the room was nowhere near the advertised standard also). According to the hotel this violates health and safety law and they couldn't simply put an extra bed in the room. We had to pay for a triple room. Significantly more than the initial booking I paid for, for three adults. I could have got a better price on a triple through Trivago and laterooms (and many other sites) for many other hotels around the same distance from central London. Beware making a booking with them; if they're the cheapest, there's probably something wrong. The staff had a terrible attitude towards us when they realised their own mistake. They tried to blame the website, but they clearly didn't check the booking details before confirming it! Hence it is their fault. I still had to pay else they threatened to throw us out with no refund. The manager was very rude to me about the whole mix-up. She raised her voice at me and was extremely condescending; she made it very clear the customer is not always right and I can leave without getting my money back if I didn't like her rules. Ludicrous. Will never risk going with them again myself; If you really think the price is great, call them before committing to pay for the non-refundable deals. The room itself was very no-frills. It was noisy through the night; we could hear people above, below and around us. The mattresses are awful; I work in a prison and they're the same ones! The television is awful. Only 5 channels and the signal was so bad we could only watch BBC1 at best. The bathroom was shabby; mold growing on the sealant around the bath and sink and floor. The breakfast was a shambles. They ran out of food, cutlery and milk. The food that was there was stone cold. I was in a long queue of other customers in the same position, just wanting to get out of there with a full stomach and explore London. In the end I had cold egg on half-toasted bread, eaten with a knife and spoon! The only good thing I have to say is the room was warm enough.

Reviews.Title: “The star rating must be different...”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was listed as a 3 star hotel and cost about $120 a night. We expected a much more modern accomodation than what we found. Bayswater Inn is at the brink of closure, so all of the bedding, towels, furniture, carpet is old and dingy. We would not recommend staying there. While clean and quiet, it was too expensive for such limited amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprising”
Reviews.Author: Helle_Maria_Andersen
Reviews.Content: London hotels are normally not something to remember especially at this price range, but I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel! Me and my friend stayed here a weekend in the beginning of March and the room we got was much bigger than I had expected. The inventory was very standard with two beds (one single and one double), and even though the room was located in the basement, we still had a window that could open. The hotel is located in a nice and quiet backpack'ish area, just 5 min. walk to two different tube stations; Bayswater and just further up the street is Queensway. We walked to the market in Notting Hill which was only a 10-15 min. walk. The breakfast was not worth getting up to, but still had more choices than what I had expected. If you're looking for a cheap hotel with a good location this is a good choice. It's not the Hilton, but compared to other London hotels at this price, this is a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wouldn't want to spend more than a night there!”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011, just as a crash pad after a night out in London. Unfortunately, didn't get to do much crashing considering between 4-6am I was kept awake my people literally running and shouting down the corridor! The walls and doors are paper thin so it was very disturbing and really did make me angry because they were being so loud and inconsiderate!! Obviously i'm sure this doesn't happen every night, but light sleepers beware! This is an average place to stay if you just need somewhere for the night - we absolutely love Bayswater so it was more location than anything, but it wasn't really worth the money (Â£80 for one night) due to the fact we asked for a double bed and were given twins! Also the breakfast was crap, have vivid memories of just a large bowl of baked beans placed on the side and a lot of bread rolls. Stay here if you just need a place to stay for 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY SMELLY AND A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: andy m
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel to stay in London then whatever you do DO NOT stay here. The only thing going for this dump is the location.After checking in was given keys to 105 a family room that was DIRTY AND SMELLY.The carpet was sticky the walls had staines the room STANK !!!! Wife and daughter burst into tears,had to book into another hotel around the corner (the phoenix) Whatever you do not book this hotel YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: christmaskaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and it is manned I believe 24 hours a day, we were greeted by a friendly member of staff and the check in was easy, the room was on the 3rd floor we had 3 single beds with a put you up kind of bed for my 3 year old ,it was clean and basic with a kettle and cups and a hair dryer the bathroom was clean, the curtains were old and so was the paper but they are redoing the hotel they have quite a few rooms since November and you can not tell that they are doing building work. The Breakfast was fine we could choose from scrambled egg, sausage, toast and pastries and fruit cocktail and also cereal the drinks were tea, hot chocolate orange and apple juice. It was fairly nice area and there are cafes and shops within a few minutes including a Mcdonalds, I would use this hotel again. The only reason it has 2 stars from me for children activities is that there was none

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY, DIRTY, DIRTY,”
Reviews.Author: heather a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting, we checked into our room only to find dirty bedding, pubic hair and head hair in our beds, beds like childrens beds , demanded a change of room, 2nd room not that much better, bedding again dirty, water in shower didnt drain away due to limescale and dirt in plughole, carpets vile, cooked breakfast served on a tiny sideplate ( no kidding) windows not double glazed, shook when doors getting closed, rooms smell musty, dirt and hair in teacup in our room, the owners of this hotel should be ashamed of themself, the staff that we spoke to were friendly enough but did not seem to care about how bad the place is, nice location, this hotel could be lovely if it was cleand up, dont waste your money staying here,

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have every stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Pizzicata
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disaster. We booked a double room and got a room in the basement which was so tiny that there was even no space to open a luggage. The window did not close, there was no hot water. Staff was rude and after we demanded to change the room it took as a lot of time to convince them that it is necessary. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mariajanette
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in November for my daughter and her cousin as the hotel is well located and the deal was good. However, the location is the only positive about this hotel. Already when they arrived to the hotel my daughter phoned due to some "problem" with the booking and a very unfriendly receptionist. My daughter could not carry the luggage herself due to an injury (her wrist had a bandage clearly visible), but the staff refused to help. The room was dirty and it was not possible to close the window. The staff could not care less about the window. They seam to have no clue about customer care, customer satisfaction, or being in controll of their grumpy moods.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in the basement”
Reviews.Author: ASTP
Reviews.Content: The room was in the basement of the hotel, near the lift. It is hard to sleep. Breakfast disaster.The only good thing is the proximity of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for- Basic and noisy but not awful!”
Reviews.Author: fizzyinch
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here last weekend and after reading the reviews we were really dreading it but I can honestly say it's not THAT bad. Yes it is dated and basic but if you are just going to London to sight-see and need somewhere to sleep then it is perfect- it's about a 5 minute walk from Bayswater tube stop. Our room was very small but had everything we needed; a clean shower, sink, toilet, tea/coffee making facilities, a double bed and a dressing table. We were in the basement room which didn't have sunlight which was slightly bizarre. The bed was slightly wonky but the worst thing about the hotel was the noise. The walls are very thin and you can hear people most of the morning. We also expected the breakfast to be horrendous after reading some of these reviews but i was pleasantly surprised- egg, sausage, beans, croissants, jams, a selection of breads and yogurts. You get what you pay for; we got a really cheap deal for a zone 1 location with breakfast so we didn't expect an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time for them to clean the carpets”
Reviews.Author: pero305
Reviews.Content: Apart from being well located and cheap (caught a special booking deal online), I can hardly find any advantage of this hotel. It is disgustingly dirty, the staff doesnÂ´t care about anything at all. Watch out as they have rooms in the street level (semi-basement)....no wifi, no daylight there, be careful!

Reviews.Title: “two happy bunnies”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMcCarthy
Reviews.Content: my granddaughter and i went to london and stayed here,lots of bad reviews but old enough to make up my own mind,didn't pay ritz prices so wasn't expecting ritz standards,excellent location,friendly,helpful staff,clean room,breakfast was adequate,we WIIL go there every time we are in london,

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else! There was blood on the bedspread!”
Reviews.Author: Christina R
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. It is disgusting and dirty! There was blood on the bedspread!! I called to the front desk to let them know about the unclean linen and they could have cared less. I asked them to bring me a fresh one and they said no if I wanted a new one I'd have to come get it. So, I went with the bloody linen to the front desk where a extremely rude front desk clerk proceeded to answer the phone while I was talking. I told him in an extremely loud voice that I was talking to him first and how dare he answer a call in the middle of me talking. I told him that the soiled linen was unexceptionable (still talking loud) which seemed to get his attention since the whole lobby had silenced to listen to my outburst. I finally got a clean blanket. Too make matters worse there was little heat in the room (we were there in November). The bed size that we booked was suppose to be a queen it turned out to be a little larger than a twin bed and short too. Thankfully, I my friend and I are 5'5'' and under otherwise, we would have been too tall for the bed. I was also thankful that I was staying with my best friend of 20 years since we had to sleep like sardines! The window was greyed out and didn't open which was very strange. Breakfast was a small bread roll and jam. Everything else was extra and over priced! All in all do not waste your time or your money on this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chrys W
Reviews.Content: Our stay last week was a pleasant surprise since we expected little having read some reviews about this hotel. The twin room was big enough to keep luggage and get about. The bathroom had clean towels etc. There was a hairdryer and tea making facilities too. The breakfast buffet with continental and cooked food was good and the service attentive. There was no remote for the TV but it was fixed later. However there were only limited channels and surprisingly not some of the UK channels

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel Ive ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely filthy, the rooms was disgusting. Pure filth. Avoid at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one!”
Reviews.Author: mandajaneb
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with this hotel and would definately not recommend it. The room was large, but vey tatty with holes in the walls and skirting board. Everywhere was grimy, the windows were so dirty that you could hardly see out of them. There was no lock on the inside of the door as it had broken off. None of the windows locked or shut properly. Plastic covered mattresses on tiny beds. Cheap sachets of coffee and polystirene cups - yuk. The toilet leaked and there was a smear of faeces on the wall. Then there was breakfast.....bowls of cereal stacked up and uncovered. Side plates provided to hold your cold scrambelled egg, cold sausages, and bread rolls. Tinned fruit was also on offer. Coffee was the same cheap sachets of coffee as in the bedroom, which you had to make up yourself with a jug of hot water. The dining room had a huge water stain on the ceiling. The only clean part of the hotel was the foyer. The only good thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimLancashire
Reviews.Content: To be honest, for what we paid (Â£28 per night) for a London hotel this is great! Fantastic location, 15 mins tube ride to the centre, 15 mins walk to Hyde Park, 5 mins walk to the nearest tube station, nice little town and pubs near by 5 mins walk. The rooms are very basic and dated, however if this is just a base to sleep and be out all day in London it is great. The room was cleaned every day while we were out, staff were very helpful and friendly! Breakfast, hmm.. Not great, choice could be a little better, but what did we expect. I would stop here again for the pure location of the place, if you get over the basic hotel and get your head around it not being a 5 or 4 or 3 star hotel then this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Finnley09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bayswater Inn with my partner in Nov 11 and for Â£49 inc breakfast was worth it. The room was dated, but, London hotels are so expensive and this was half the price of any others so I was expecting a dive, but it wasn't that bad! The tube was a two minute walk away, and Paddington station was about a ten minute walk I will stay here again as im not one for staying in a hotel and only use it to sleep, for the money its exactly what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oscar M
Reviews.Content: Good location for local shops, restaurants, underground and buses. Near to Hyde park and kensington gardens. The hotel room looked tired and dated. Beds were uncomfortable, shower room very small. I would have preferred crockery rather than plastic cups in the room. Some of the staff were not very friendly and looked miserable. Breakfast was not worth getting up for, unless you paid extra Â£7 per person.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Agnes Martine J
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 15 people who stayed at this hotel and I will not claim that this was anything more than an OK hotel. When we stayed here in January, it was freezing cold in the rooms and the showers were not warm either. Breakfast was very average, nothing special as tempted, but the quality of what was there was nice. It is EXTREMELY thin walls between the rooms, so you can easily hear what's happening in the next room:) The rooms were small, simple standard. Close to Bayswater underground metro and the hotel had good service - they were very helpful! This hotel was all in all, okay, I think I'll try another one if I go to London again.

Reviews.Title: “Better sleep under a bridge”
Reviews.Author: turtle01hh
Reviews.Content: Breakfast should have you water your mouth, not your eyes - a receptionist trying to convince you that obvious deficits of the 'hotel' were caused by you - and last not least, only plug in to shave if you intend to [---] yourself.......

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Brid m
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend thiis hotel to a friend,the staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful and did not speak good english. Only one of the staff, a latvian man was friendly and welcoming. i had to ask for towels to be sent to my room three times before i eventually got them, i was told they were very busy even though i asked over a five hour period. one of the reception staff couldnt understand what i wanted. the first night my parents stayed there they were in the basement with no air conditioning and only one window. they eventually managed to be moved the next day. i arrived two days later and the hotel staff wanted me to share a room my parents, despite the fact that i had paid for my own room. they insisted at first that i had booked a single bed, not a single room. When i finally got to the room it was tiny and the lock on door was broken. The room was clean but very shabby and the bed was not very comfortable. I was not impressed with the polysterine cups or the paper bath mat. It was a great location and was quiet but i i would not stay here again. i have stayed in better hostels in asia! it does not look like it was advertised!

Reviews.Title: “Only for the location”
Reviews.Author: Paulina W
Reviews.Content: I'm Polish and I'm personally in love with Notting Hill which in my opinion is the best part of London. I stayed in Bayswater Inn during my business trip while attending Sourcing Summit in London...didn't stay there much because we'd leave the hotel early morning and come back late in the evening. I'm convinced that BI is an ideal proposal for people who don't want to spend a lot of money on the hotels and don't plan to spend much time in the hotel room. Rooms are terribly small and claustrophobic, wi-fi available only in the hotel lobby, hotel breakfast really really poor (bare minimum, hideous coffee). Ah, don't believe the pictures published on their website because they don't reflect the reality. Furniture are old, beds too narrow, they offer polysterene cups! I stayed there November 2010 and the window wouldn't close...The hotel staff is friendly though. If I was to recommend this hotel it is only because of its location in Notting Hill.

Reviews.Title: “No Reservation Record”
Reviews.Author: Kylie N
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter on her first night of a month's travel arrived here to be told she did not have a booking and that they were full - she had booked and fully paid for the room 7 weeks earlier! After them finally accepting her reservation and payment proof she was moved to their 'sister hotel' with a promise of fully paid taxi transport to her tour start location (300m from this hotel) at 5.45am the next morning . No taxi was booked and she had to pay for the fare herself. A great intro to the UK. Poor form!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - 3 Star it's not - I've stayed in better hostels!”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: The Bayswater Inn Hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!! It is clearly a low end budget establishment, which is not what their website would have you believe. I will list the reasons below: *The hotel is smelly and dirty *The "beds" are metal framed camp beds with thin hard mattresses - almost impossible to sleep on, I had to put the quilt underneath to get some comfort *The TVs don't work *The rooms are supplied with polystyrene cups to drink tea/coffee - I had to insist the hotel provide me with a proper cup *The windows are not secure, can't be locked and my room had a flat roof outside *My room stank, the carpet is filthy and the walls are dirty *The bathroom still had remnants of previous occupants (won't go into detail....) *The doors bang with an alarming volume - wakes everyone up if you don't grab the door before it impacts with the frame *The staff are less than helpful and just advised me to complain to my booking agent!!! It was a dreadful stay and I would never go back again. On the plus side, it is quite close to Bayswater tube station and the location is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: innesm
Reviews.Content: Many of the staff were off-hand, giving the impression that you were an unwelcome distraction (although one guy did smile when he said he hoped we had had a nice stay). On check-in we were handed a crude photocopy of the hotel 'rules', adding to the 'social security' vibe. Don't get your hopes up about the 'free breakfast' - it's a bowl of rice crispies, cup of tea/bad coffee, toast and bread rolls. We gave it a miss on day two and went to a nearby cafe, the Byzantium, instead. The room was depressing, had been fitted out some time in the late 70's/80's. The TV was tiny, the remote didn't work, the ceiling light was an office-style 'tile' in a horrible lowered ceiling. The complementary tea bags were tasteless. The bathmat was a piece of paper with 'bath mat' printed on it(!) The shower was fixed to the wall and unmovable. Really, this hotel is not aiming for any repeat business, and is focussed on fooling people into paying to stay there, while making the bare minimum effort and maximising profits.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: NatB1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a relatively good location close to the subway with a great pub down the road. The rooms were very very small, We had one room with three beds which left no room for our suitcases. The bathroom was the size or an aeroplane bathroom. The staff were quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The only advantage is its in the central part”
Reviews.Author: Praatik
Reviews.Content: If you have no choice, then go for this Hotel, too cramoed room for you to fit in alongwith your super bag and if you've got a kid too fit in then. God help you. The location was the only advantage else the hotel would not be the one I would like to return again to. Rather choose to stay a bit far off near any tube so that accessability to central london is taken care of

Reviews.Title: “Try a cardboard box!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dieseldave1983
Reviews.Content: What a dump. I wouldn't even ask my dog to stay here! First room they gave us was in the basment, it stank. Think all they had done to 'clean' it was make the bed. There were hairs on the beches and carpets were not clean, no external light etc. Got moved to a room on fourth floor, no better. Room was at a slant, again not clean. Bath had someones hair still in it. We booked another hotel,and checked into it, and the staff were unpleasent, unhelpful and uninterested, which suggeste we weren't the first to do what we did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL WE HAVE EVER STAYED IN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alaine345
Reviews.Content: On appearance to the reception it looked okay, but once inside the bedrooms it was a different story, the carpets are dirty and stained, and the curtains are the same to. The bathroom shower did not work it just gave you cold water, during the night i got up to go to the toilet and a cockroach was walking along the bathroom floor. The beds are terrible, they need completely renewing one of the beds if you can call it that was a plank of wood and a paper thin mattress basically the beds looked about 30 years old, no one got any sleep so the next day we we really tired. One thing the sheets were clean but the were very old. Overall the bedroom was unrateable i would class it as a youth hostel not a 3 star hotel. The breakfast was okay a bit un-organised you had to wait for things to cook and get sorted at one point i was waiting 5 minutes just for a glass of WARM orangejuice. BASICALLY DONT COME HERE IT WAS TERRIBLE, we left the next day to book into the premier inn kensington, i would recomend there, THANK GOOD WE DID AS THE PREMIER INN WAS LOVELY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: Sackbut58
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel, we were unsure of what we were letting ourselves in for. However, we found the staff welcoming and friendly and our triple room, although basic, was clean and met our needs. If you are in London to sight-see or attend shows and just need a place to sleep, this hotel is fine. It is only a short walk to the tube and you can be in Central London in about 15 mins. There have been a number of negative comments regarding the continental breakfast, but we found it good. Provided you are happy with 'no frills', this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel very basic”
Reviews.Author: Mrsgetaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights so the fact the hotel was very basic wasn't too much of a problem. It was near two underground stations, although Bayswater was closed when we were there, but Queensway was just a little further on. The reception area was nice but it was a different story up in the rooms and corridors. We were on the second floor and the hall carpet was badly stained - not a good look! We were in room 218 and had the devil of a job getting the key to work in the door. It really needs attention! ( I notice previous occupants had the same problem ) The room was basic with three single beds which were reasonably comfortable, and although there wasn't much room to move around it was adequate. We had a bath towel each but no hand towels, a paper bath mat which was useless and polystyrene cups for the tea and coffee. Continental breakfast was a joke, It was tea, coffee, juice and rolls with jam or butter. Again very basic, and on our second morning we went out and had breakfast nearby. The bar was also basic. We went in for a nightcap on our first evening and there was was no atmosphere at all, and the barman hung around listening to our conversation which made us feel rather uncomfortable and we ended up going to bed early. The only thing going for it was the location but if you book a budget hotel in London I suppose you should expect it to be basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Bonnieh1048
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the past and had always had a positive experience until about three years ago. Located just steps away from two tube stations, buses, shopping and lots of restaurants, this hotel would seem to be the ideal landing spot for a visit to London. However, this hotel now caters ONLY to groups and will totally mess up the lives of independent travelers. They will attempt to move you to a less convenient 'sister' hotel that they claim is more posh. The included 'breakfast' consists of a variety of hot brown waters, stale rolls and the equivalent of Tang. Fortunately there is a Starbucks nearby. The rooms are OK for London and kept clean. The independent traveler will get a room with a dramatic view of the airshaft. The television sets in every room I have ever stayed in there are pretty awful and will offer up to four channels if you are lucky. Wifi is available in the lobby only and is not free. Fortunately there us a Starbucks, Burger King and McDonald's nearby with free Wifi, as well as an Internet cafe in the close by Whiteley's center. None of the staff are native English speakers. I keep staying here because of the great location. I am not a sadist however, and will no longer recommend this hotel for myself or the average independent traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: CherryBombPow
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bayswater Inn when I was on a journey with my school. It was an awful hotel to say the least. When we walked into the lobby it looked clean and tidy, so I thought it was going good so far. Then we got given our keys and headed up the stairs. As soon as we reached the bottom of the stairs we could smell and dirty smell that was really unpleasant. Then we got up to our room (218) on the second floor and could not get the key to open the door. No matter how much we twisted and turned it we could not get it to open, so we had to get a member of staff to help us. Once inside, the room was not up to our expectations. There were 4 girls in my group and the room consisted of 3 single beds and one camp bed where the springs had broken and the matress was torn. There was even blood and stains all over my quilt cover so obviously it had not been washed in a few years!! Then we noticed that there were paper bath mats that were competely useless and only polistirine cups to have tea/coffee etc! The room was a long, but thin rectangular shape so we had no room to move - if two of us were walking past eachother in the space one would have to stop to let the other past - it was that bad. Even the electrical plugs were awful, one of the girls in my room tried to turn her straighters on and the plug made them blow up! The hairdryer was also pathetic, if at all you are staying here, bring one of your own. In our room the fan in the bathroom was broken. We were 4 teenage girls staying in a room, we all had to shower every morning and the bathroom was all steamed up, it felt like it was around 90 degrees when it was the last persons turn to go in. At night, we ended up pushing two of the single beds together, whilst putting the camp bed matress on top in the middle and 3 of s slept in these 2 single beds - not acceptable!! I would have to say that the worst part of the hotel service was the breakfast, it was absolutely awful. The hotel advertises that it is a "Continental Breakfast" but I can assure you for a fact that it is far from it. All we got served was a bread roll with butter and jam. That was it. We noticed that some guests were eating bacon, eggs, toast, cereal, sausages etc, but then we found out that they had to pay for them (Â£2 for 3 sausages!) What a rip off!! We ended up just going hungry until we got something decent to eat at lunch time. I think the only good thing about this hotel is that there was a MacDonalds and a Tesco Express shop at the end of the road so this is the place to go if you want to have something to eat. To be honest, I think sleeping in a cardboard box would make you feel more at home!!

Reviews.Title: “After a rough start, was satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: tsf21860
Reviews.Content: Had read reviews where vacationers were bumped to another hotel. But didn't think it would happen to us. We were very unhappy about it, but took the taxi to the "sister" hotel. The Majestic Hotel was anything but Majestic. The taxi picked us up early the next morning. We were very worried about what was waiting for us behind the door. The day we arrived there was a woman screaming about the condition of her room (she wouldn't let her dog stay in that room). But we were pleasantly surprised. Though not a 4 star hotel, it was quite adequate. As others have said, it was on a lovely quiet street and very close to the Tube and many tourist spots. Breakfast was simple, but tasty. We did encounter a rude gentleman upon arrival, but other staff members were more than helpful. Saturnino in particular, was wonderful! The staff helped us straighten out transfers to Heathrow. Making calls and faxing documents.Would stay again if do not get bumped to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the location, why not”
Reviews.Author: jenaipas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as bad as the rating would make you beleive. It is a fact that the hotel could do with a major overhaul but the basics are covered. The beds are acceptable and the rooms fairly roomy by London standards. However, the furniture is is need of replacement and the bath room is a fine exemple of british plumbing. One wonders why so many tubes are needed to bring so little water and so little pressure to the sink. I would recommand using the restroom at the groundfloor since it seems to flush better than the one in our room on the 4th floor. The breakfast is very limited but you'll find plenty of nice breakfast places within 5 minutes walking. The service is non existing and the tables are not as clean as they should be. The staff at the counter is rather unfriendly by they give the info you need.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: mezbrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July, booked a twin and double room. We arrived and were told we have 2 twin rooms, they were apolgetic about the mistake and said we could have the double room from the 2nd night onwards, not a big deal. The staff (aside from the gentleman who booked us in) were so rude, they answered the phone whilst you were talking to them then put their hand up in your face to stop you talking, they were incredibly inpatient and unhelpful. If you asked them to re-explain directions they huffed at you and rolled their eyes. Not impressed at all. Rooms were very basic, plastic cups for your tea and paper bathmats, nothing special. The rooms were cleaned each day though which was good. There were no irons or fans and they asked you to pay a Â£20 deposit for each of these items! I rathered pay a dry cleaner than the hotel considering how rude they were when I asked for an iron and a fan. To say they offer breakfast is false advertising, the only food which is part of your room charge is bread rolls and jam, even cereal has a charge. We have since dined out for breakfast everyday. Aside from all the negatives it is in a fantastic area and close to shops and restaurants (for you breakfast!). The service needs improving and I don't think the rooms are value for money. I won't be back, mainly due to the rude and impatient staff (aside from one man..).

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stayed at in 10yrs”
Reviews.Author: tonyandandrea
Reviews.Content: First the good news clean sheets fluffy towels .Thats it.The bad news.Artex in dirty white colour ,curtains that would not draw fully across.wallpaper hanging off walls in bathroom.Mould around bath (room 427) obviously never heard of bleach when cleaning.A paper bath mat (what help is that ?).Polystrene cups for coffee !.Breakfast was a nightmare had to give order on piece of paper to manager . Basic quality when it finally arrived.Receptionist was wearing dirty off white shirt with tie half way down to waist.Yes we made a mistake going 3 star instead of our normal 4.This is probably not worth a 2 star .I have advised Superbreaks with whom the hotel was booked to investigate.It is jeopardising their reputation.This is not a hotel in the true sense of the word it is a hostel .Not even think of going there

Reviews.Title: “Okay, place to stay at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: Vistor90012
Reviews.Content: Booked an all inclusive trip and ended up at the Bayswater. The rooms were satisfactory and at the end of a long day they were sufficient. As they say "You get what you paid" and we got what we paid for, but were content. The continental breakfast was seriously lacking and we had to go out for breakfast at other locations. The Prince Edward Pub down the street was really good for dinner. It was a nice and fairly quiet location not to far from the tube and Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage hotel at the center of London”
Reviews.Author: agnimitra
Reviews.Content: We had one night stay at this hotel during a stop over and our agent chose it for being in close proximity of central London. Loved the old world charm. Rooms were a bit small but clean and well maintained. Breakfast did not include any cold cut or eggs - only breads / croissants and coffee!! Best part of this hotel is the location...very close to Bayswater Tube station on the Circle line. Also only couple of mins away from the Hyde Park. We went for an early morning walk to Hyde Park and it was lovely. Would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Contender for worst hotel in Bayswater”
Reviews.Author: Tripper2Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Bayswater Inn in 2008 and thought it was basic, but fairly comfortable. Maybe we were just naÃ¯ve as this was our first overseas trip. Anyway, as our hotel couldnâ€™t fit us in for the last three nights, we decided to go back to the Bayswater Inn. It's in a great location and is on the right side of London for Heathrow. This was probably the worst decision we made on our trip. The hotel is appalling and it is apparent the owners have done nothing to modernise or renew in years. I can forgive the polystyrene cups, but to still use the paper bath mats is a joke. Once wet, they slip all over the floor, risking guests safety. We asked for an extra towel and used that as a bath mat. Other reviews have mentioned the unfriendly reception staff. On this visit, the staff member was actually helpful and pleasant. Perhaps he is new to the job. We went up to the room and couldnâ€™t open the door with the key. Reception came up and opened it, but walked away quickly. The room was totally inadequate. There was a bed shoved against the wall and no space at all for our suitcases. When you are travelling from overseas, you donâ€™t just have hand luggage. We closed the door quickly and went back to Reception. Luckily the manager gave approval to change the room, but I donâ€™t think she was too happy about it given the tone (and loudness) of her voice. The next room again couldnâ€™t be opened but while my husband was going back to the front desk, I was able to unlock the door. Who knew you would need specialist skills to open a lock?? One turn full left and then a hard turn to the right as far as it will go. The room was bigger with two beds, a double and single. The curtains were torn, the bedspreads and duvets looked as if they hadnâ€™t been washed in months and after sitting on the beds, we knew a good nights sleep was not going to happen. Any padding in the mattresses had long gone and you could feel every spring. They sagged in the middle which wasnâ€™t helped by the fact that they were fold-up beds, not â€˜realâ€™ beds. The bathroom was pretty ordinary, with an ill-fitting toilet seat that wouldnâ€™t stay still. Iâ€™ve already mentioned those paper bath mats. I hated this hotel and if I had to stay one more night, would have moved out at any cost. It truly is horrible and a visit from a hotel inspector is long overdue.

Reviews.Title: “no words. never again.”
Reviews.Author: teresabattista
Reviews.Content: I have my beloved hotel in London - vancouver studios - but it was busy. So I booked through hotelbed.com this this hotel. When I arrived there they told me "sorry overbooking we move you in another hotel, in another part of London". I refused to be moved as they accepted people that came after me because they were in double and I had a single. I spole with hotelbeds.com and they were very professional so after 1 hour I had the room. Windows with big cut on it, no shower bath, no towel/carpet in the shower but a piece of paper where to put the wet feet, no air conditioning. People at the reception are terrible (the small blond boy speaks as a computer: yes mom, take a sit mom, overbooking mom"), the woman I met understood the problem and was very nice. once I told them "I am calling the police as overbooking is illegale if you accept a pre payment" they were very impressed and they gave me a double instead of a single. I have seen many people complaining for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean Room, Safe and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Jen F
Reviews.Content: We decided to fly to London spur of the moment to see the Royal Wedding. We essentially did no research on hotels as we had 4 hours to plan our trip. I booked at The Bayswater due to the prices and location. I was traveling with only my 8 year old daughter so I wanted safe, cheap and convenient. The Bayswater was perfect. I have been to London many, many times before and stayed in a vast assortment of hotels. Some BAD, most just OK. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I never expect luxury in London.I always know that the rooms will be funky. Weird beds, horrid breakfast, etc, etc. After all, we are not in America. You just jave to roll with it in LOndon and not expect too too much. Yes, the bath mat is horrid! Paper mat! ugh! The shower is an excercise in patience to be sure! The beds are rather springy camp beds but! They were clean, the bathroom was spotless. The beds clean with no bugs, our carpet was clean, the room smelled fresh and it was relatively quiet. I felt safe the whole trip being a woman traveler with a child. They even provide a safe box for my passport, ipod, etc. We loved that we could walk 7 minutes to Portobello Road in Nottinghill gate, 5 minutes to Kensington Palace /Park and the high street near the hotel was chock full of pubs, markets , Boots Drugs, a shopping mall. It was absolutely perfect! I cannot say enough about this hotel. It suited us perfectly and I am really picky! I was just telling my husband that we will stay there again on our next trip to London!

Reviews.Title: “perfect value for money.”
Reviews.Author: mawgan_19
Reviews.Content: if you were looking for a luxery hotel this isn't the place but if you want a place to eat, sleep and wash in then for the price it is a great option and is near underground station. i would recomend to anyone who want simple and good value accomidation.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather stay home then stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Dogmom11236
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for one night towards the end of a trip to Holland and Belgium, a glorified layover, so my husband and I could stay and join in cheering for the royal wedding.It was also done through an online travel sight that I have used in the past, and they will hear from me as well. Luckily it was only one night. This was one of the worst hotel rooms I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. The room, in the basement by the way, stank. The bathroom was the kind of bathroom that you want to shower with your flip flops on, so your feet do not have to touch the floor.The toliet did not flush right, and made strange noises. The beds ( yes 2 narrow twin beds) were gross. As a matter of fact, my hsband and I just stayed out with friends and came to get a few hours sleep before leaving. Neither one of us pulled the covers down and I actually took my jackets and tshirts and made a covering so I would not have to touch the blankets or sheets, and I left the light on in fear of creepy critters that may have come out. We could also hear through the walls. Please, if you are going to London, do not book this rathole.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: HolidayUSA
Reviews.Content: well theplace looked good on the internet - but were those photos actually taken at that hotel? well it was cheap, but you'd still expect to get a few hours sleep! ...and it started so well, got off the tube at Bayswater, family included, did not really know the route to the hotel, made a quick phone call and recieved perfect guidance, great part of London to. Reception, looked okay, then it began. Firstly, room was double booked, so they found another room, interior dated, room terrible, you can feel the springs in the matress when you lie down, the room spelt really bad, the taps would not turn off in the bathroom, the tv did not work - it was just grotty. Bedtime arrived and passed. the noise in the hotel was unreal, eveytime anyone in the hotel above us moved, the entire floor creaked and groaned, and the noise from other guests was nothing like I had come across before, I rang reception at 02:30 - which was a total waste of time as the operator did not speak very good english - but nothing was done and my body finally gave in about half four as the singing, dancing and joyfull celebrations carried on. I would not suggest anyone goes to this hotel, and for the same price you can get a better standard of hotel around Russel Square, and any of the Imperial Hotel family would out shine this hotel. Sorry guys - but don't waste your London experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Adequate”
Reviews.Author: grrlsprout
Reviews.Content: Before my partner and I left for our trip to London (but after we had already booked at Bayswater) I read all the terrible reviews with some trepidation. It sounds like a horrible place for the reviews! I had never traveled abroad before but my friends who had warned me that European hotels were not quite as plush as I might be used to. With this advice, my partner and I got just what we expected from Bayswater. The front desk clerks were always friendly to us- with the exception of the final morning where an older man behind the desk was somewhat rude to a traveler checking in. The room was very small, the sheets not at all plush or fancy, the bed is kind of like a camp bed. No extras, shampoo, etc. I wouldn't have made the tea that was in the room, but I never felt super creeped out or anything. It basically had everything we needed. We weren't there to hang out in the room anyway. There was no discernable heat or cooling in the room, but we had great weather so it didn't matter. I may not book here in the summer. The breakfast that is included is useless. We had it one morning and it was basically a roll with butter. For the rest of the trip we just went elsewhere or skipped breakfast in favor of the delicious sandwiches London has everywhere! There were a lot of young people, but my partner and I are both teachers and didn't mind that. We didn't have any trouble with them. All said, it is a budget hotel. Don't expect to be pampered, but I didn't think it was terrible or dirty or loud or any of that. If you are coming to your room to shower and sleep, it does that job just dandy.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Logmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night on a theatre outing. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was perfectly adequate for our needs, including the complimentary tea/coffee facility. We could not fault the cleanliness and the staff were extremely pleasant and friendly. The continental breakfast was adequate and if required could be supplemented to make a fuller meal at relatively small extra cost. The position of the hotel was fine for accessing Kensington Gardens for a lovely walk. The shopping in nearby Queensway met all requirements for a short stay and there were plenty of restaurants. Bayswater is in fact a very nice area to stroll around and enjoy the elegance of Regency and early Victorian London without the hassle of more central London areas. It is also well served for bus and underground services to many main areas of the city. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others overnighting or stopping for a few days in London.

Reviews.Title: “This is a complete and utter skank hole!”
Reviews.Author: mygreeneyedcat
Reviews.Content: After stayin here for a couple days I feel the need to express my feelings! I felt as if I was homeless and had been shoved next to the foreign exchange the whole time I was stayin here!! The walls were as thin as paper and the beds made me stratch! It sounded like a herd of elephants upstairs! And my neck felt like it was goin to snap with a floppy thin pillow! The bath mat aswell where do I start, it was so thick and fluffy or shall I say far from it! It was made out of paper which is a disgrace. To be honest I think this hotel, is an absolute disgrace and it should be shut down by the health inspectors! The matresses are like cotton wool but they have wonderful protectors to save you from those bugs at night! Don't ever stay here!! Unless you want to live like the homeless!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: academicsoo
Reviews.Content: As a lone female traveller I felt quite threatened by the gangs of loud young people wandering around the corridors and occupying the lifts. I work with students so am usually not intimidated by their behaviour. The hotel was noisy, was like a poorly run youth hostel with basic amenities, barely adequate breakfast and basic supplies in the rooms. Thank goodness I was only staying one night, never again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Ruralbird
Reviews.Content: We booked with Super Breaks for a package train and hotel deal for one night with two teenagers, my husband and myself,travelling from Rural lancashire. The situation of the hotel is convenient however inside is a different matter. The rooms were so 'meanly ' provided for ,with the absolute bare minimum, for example there was only one partially used toilet roll, one tea bag, one sachet of coffee each, no soap and no shampoo. I also noticed there was only one pillow per person and no extra blankets ( which are usually found stored in the wardrobes.) The room was fairly clean but the paint job done by whoever decorated the hotel was awfulâ€¦. An example would be in the hallways and stairs ,the plug sockets had been painted around with what looked like the neatness of a yard broom. There was also this awful one inch high step going into the bathrooms, which all of us had stubbed ours toes on! The beds were in actual fact camp beds that fold up! So we both rolled into the middle all nightâ€¦ CAMP BEDS! I cannot believe I spent all my hard earned money for one night on a cheap camp bed . Myself and my family decided to hold judgment until the morning and see what the breakfast was like.. What a disappointment !!..I had built this trip up to be the â€œtrip of a life time â€œdescribing to my teenage children the wonders of London and the infamous â€œFull Englishâ€�. All that was available was as followed: Please be assured that I do not exaggerate in any detail at all. On arrival at the lounge, one large glass salad bowl with cornflakes which one used a cup to serve oneâ€™s self a portion. Also another large salad glass bowl filled with bran flakes.No yoghurts no fruit. No toast was offerered until we found someone to make eye contact with ( all staff purposely ignored you. )We waited for 45 minutes for one sausage each,one rasher of bacon one egg and a raw (yesâ€¦TOTALLY raw ) tomato, no mushrooms,no beans no sauces ,I really must stress again that this is not exaggerated in any way! Every one else was un happy there as well ,no one was served within 45 minutes and as we left we saw a gentleman complaining to a waiter who was doing a startling impression of Manuel(from the famous British sitcom Fawlty Towers)ie.pretending that he couldnâ€™t understand English. Save your money and give this hotel a wide berth !

Reviews.Title: “A convinient but noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: deanfp
Reviews.Content: Having lived in London for ten years and still travel there on a monthly basis I have just about seen it all when it comes to London hotels. This was a vacation trip and my girlfriends first time in London. The hotel is on a square situated around 5 minutes walk from Bayswater tube. Upon arrival we were greeted by a receptionist who rather oddly asked my friend was looking for a job!. The room was a double that had a rather hard bed and also a single bed. The bathroom was dimly lit with a shower that was in the roof of the bathroom so could not be moved around. The towels were changed each day and the bath mat was paper so if sharing it can get a little wet on the floor, but above all was cleaner than most I have stayed in. The room had a TV but not cable so only the standard 5 channels. The room had a kettle, with coffee, tea and sugar but my advice is when you get there head to the store and get some decent instant coffee and tbags! The hotels were horrible. The room was cleaned on a daily basis to a good standard. My only complaint about the room was the bins were not emptied daily. The hotel is not a quiet one and the majority of guests were between 21 and 30 and could be heard when coming back from a night in. But the loudest of all were the cleaning staff who seemed to argue constantly. Breakfast is your standard rolls, cereal, juice and coffee and if you get up around 8am then fine, otherwise there are plenty of local cafes serving far better food. In summary the hotel is a place to get your head down and sleep, not to stay too long in. But certainly better than many I have stayed in. If anything the staff's noise level lets it down. Also no WIFI so head to the local pub 1 minute away, great free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: sdelo1
Reviews.Content: Good location. Friendly and helpful staff (outside of 1 grumpy old guy). Clean and simple rooms. Dining is typical of small European hotel with buffet breakfast. Americans may not consider this 3-star level in comparison to Holiday Inns and so forth, but this is a great value in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “OUTDATED KIDDED ON WIFI, 1 ARROGANT STAFF MEMBER, GOOD BREKKIE THOUGH”
Reviews.Author: shanierock
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this for my 40th and we went with our two young children. On arrival all seemed nice, I was expecting something special as the travel agents had told the hotel it was my 40th, but there was no mention of this, wasnt that bothered but it would have been nice if it was mentioned. The rooms were very basic, there were these plastic cups for the drinks. The fittings were shabby, the hot water from the tap was a trickle so had to fill the sink up using the water from the bath tap and one of the plastic cups. There was human excrement on the toilet seat when my young son lifted it up to use the toilet!!! The bathroon was like a shoe box. The room was pretty warm, but I woke up with a headache each morning and I wished that I had brought a carbon monoxide reader with me! It was quiet were we were so that was ok. The telly has a blue strip down the side when we watched anything. We discovered that the on our card the date of departure was earlier then the date we checked in!! but that was sorted. It stated that free wifi was available, but was not had to pay Â£10.00. There was one arrogant male staff member with ginger hair who was absolutely so so rude to my husband when he said he didnt have his breakfast card to get our key back after an evening out, I was surprised how my husband kept his cool. On the plus side, I liked the breakfast, but my husband thought the way it was organised was a bad set up. He opened the teapot to find about fifty teabags in it which looked as though fresh ones had been chucked on top of used ones many times. I didnt have a cup of tea. The orange juice looked like dirty dishwater. Would not even recommend this to Frank Gallagher!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Janet2225
Reviews.Content: You will be disappointed if you stay at this hotel! The list of things they did wrong is huge. Service was terrible, breakfast was minimal (the juice and tea was watered down), paper bath mats in the bathrooms, tiny rooms that are old and not maintained, poor service if you need their help for anything, elevators did not work one day, rooms smelled terrible, wake up call came 15 minutes late, workers are argumentative when you complain, can't use the telephone unless you leave a credit card and 50 pounds deposit even for local calls, coffee and tea in the room is provided in cheap cups that can't be used. It ruined our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, tacky and excedingly poor value”
Reviews.Author: MikeW1203
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for what should have been a pleasurable "theatre" weekend booked through a "reputable" local travel agent,who had assured my wife (who had organised the weekend as a present" that it was of good quality and close to the theatre. We were disappointed and went to ask for a room change but heard someone else in front of us being told there were no rooms to change as we only had three hours before the show wew were going to was due to start we resogned ourselves to stay. When leaving for the theatre we were aware that the "Circle Line" was not running so asked if the reception could get us a taxi (we had gven ourselves just over an hour to get there) having been told by the travel agent it was a 10 minute walk we worked out on the map that we would not walk it in two hours, reception made one phone call (not in English) and told us that it would be a least 40 to 50 minutes before we could get one. We then set out to find a cab and had a 35 minute drive to the theatre it cost us Â£15.00 each way, so not really convenient or close. We wish we had read the reviews before we went everything you read on theses pages other than someone saying it is good value and accomodation is true. Tiny room, 4 foot double bed with a plastic sheet under the sheets, tiny bathroom had to sit on the toilet side ways to avoid the towel rail with legs under the tiny sink, we were on the 4th floor in a tiny attic room, the floor sloped, there was a tiny step into the room, tiny step into the bathroom so small you almosts missed them untill you trip or stubbed your toe. The polystyrene cups and powdered creamer were something else, breakfast was the most hostile eating event I have every experienced anywhere, little or no English spoken by staff and the "free" breakfast which we could not lose our voucher for was worth missing. I cannot overstress how disappointed you will feel to give any of your hard earned money to this hotel, there were a number of foreign visitors at the hotel and it was embaressing to think that they would think this hotel represented the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic living. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: anniwhere
Reviews.Content: A good hotel if you are looking for the basics. The elevator is a plus (climbing 5 floors everyday gets old fast). The staff is friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast is not amazing but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - I CANNOT SAY IT MORE CLEARLY THAN THAT”
Reviews.Author: mscotthale
Reviews.Content: Unsafe, unsanitary and is the farthest thing from a 3-star hotel. Carpets were old, worn, and and stained. Beds were basically cots with a thin mattress on top of a metal webbing (no box springs). The bathroom was filthy. The doors were operated by skeleton keys (and no I'm not kidding). The leaflet when you check in says "DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING VALUABLE IN YOUR ROOM". This place makes Motel 6 look like the Ritz, and that's a serious statement. Avoid this hotel. Stay somewhere safe. We checked out early, took a two night penalty and paid out of pocket for five days elsewhere. That's how bad it was.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be worse !”
Reviews.Author: NairaOsl0
Reviews.Content: This hotel went beyond all the borders of my understanding of a bad hotel. Nothing was even close to acceptable: the staff is incompetent and unhelpful, they are good at making things even more complicated for their guests (if it is possible to feel like a guest at all), the management never had time to talk to us during 3 days of your stay and the only way to communicate via e-mail, the madras was warned out, you could feel the structure of the bed directly in your body, the bath was out of function. The wireless internet costs GBP 5 pr hour and is available only in the lobby (difficult to believe it is possible in 2010 in London)! The whole property is unmaintained and looks "tired and bored". The thing they call "continental breakfast" consists of tea, coffee, toast (that you have to ask for), butter and jam, NOTHING else! Conclusion! Donâ€™t go there if you have a little respect for your money, for that place is not worth even a penny!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: DaveSenior
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in a room on the fourth floor. It was clean and comfortable with a coffee/tea making facillities, hairdryer, radio and TV. All working OK. It was relatively quiet and we had a good nights sleep. Breakfast was reasonable for the price. The Hotel is well placed for getting to the tube. Bayswater and Queensway are a short distance away. Queensway Street has lots of different shops and restaurants. Basically we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy cubicle they call a bedroom”
Reviews.Author: m50lws
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny although classed as a standard and the bed was only 3/4 pushed against the wall to make the room look larger. Even the toilet was difficult to sit on because of the heated towel rail, It was near the lift which seemed to be operating all night with excessive noise. The staff spoke many languages but for most English was at best their second language. Breakfast was a Continental (allegedly) not a croissant or cooked meat in sight, english rolls and strawberry jam.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing good except location”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekBagri
Reviews.Content: THe hotel had a fantastic location right next to the station of Bayswater. Otherwise the breakfast sucked really badly. The bed were not at all comfortable and the rooms were like a mouse hole. Not all value for money. Moreover when we complained about the bed, they refused to change the room as they did not have any even though we saw fresh people come in.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs Scriver. A Mature traveller”
Reviews.Author: jenniferbonnie
Reviews.Content: My booking was made 07/08/10. After a long day travelling I arrived at the hotel. Eventually attended to only to be told they were moving me to another hotel. They would get me a taxi. I was not told why, or, which hotel I was being transfered to. I ha to ask. The hotel I was transfered to was the Troy Hotel. I had the worst stay in any hotel I have ever experienced. I would not recommend either of these hotels no matter how cheap they are.

Reviews.Title: “It really is utterly awful”
Reviews.Author: JoBo04
Reviews.Content: Yes, all the bad reviews are completely accurate. Better than sleeping on the street. But nothing else in its favour. Truely ghastly. Thank goodness was for only one night. Booked via Last Minute. We tried to get moved.. really really tried.. but all they could offer was a hotel in Hertfordshire! London was full up. Ha ha! Theatre was bad too. Walked out after first act!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous, grotty,old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: lil1977
Reviews.Content: Bad size BASEMENT room, polystyrene cups which I hate, powdered cream to go with the tea, a paper bath mat, tiny bath towels, and for that to come from a 5ft size 10 women says it all, tiny single beds. So thats the room. Have no expectations for breakfast. As many of the about comments have stated, its bread rolls,jam and cereal. If you ask for toast from any of the staff that don't speak English expect to wait. I was discusted by this!! Location. Well we bought this as a theatre break package. It took us 45mins to get to our theatre Which made us 30 mind late. I can't think of any good to say about this hotel. If you have to pay more than Â£20 for this hotel DONT BOOK IT!!""

Reviews.Title: “Good location all you need for a night in London”
Reviews.Author: GirlsOnTour33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Bayswater on Aug 31st, we got an offer with show tickets to see Billy Elliott. Friendly receptionist at check in, room was fine, bit dated but very clean and quite spacious for London ! Bathroom was quite large and clean. Continental breakfast was included in the offer and it was only rolls with jam or butter !! Could have paid for English I think but we didn't bother. Very good location 10 minutes walk to Bayswater tube, quiet area, very nice setting, felt ok walking late at night back to hotel. On the main road near Tube station there is several restaurants and a Tesco Express which is handy for drinks etc. Overall good base for overnight stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “OUT OF ORDER”
Reviews.Author: jady--15
Reviews.Content: well i went to stay at this hotel with my family and we got there and the people at the reseption were rude to us and we gave them our confirmation letter as we had pre - booked over the phone and the man at the reseption had a smerk on his face and said we have a little problem so we asked what and he told us that they were fully booked and we would have to be moved to another hotel and we would have to pay for the taxi to get there but in the end we manged to get them to pay for the taxi but it was so fustrating as we had booked a show for that night and by the time they had sorted everything it was nearly time for it to start and we had not even left luckly we got there in time ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh stressfull or what.

Reviews.Title: “If you aren't demanding luxury, then this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: AntonJuliusWest
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel when we visited London in '09. I had read about this hotel a few days before we left home, and I was expecting the worst. Fortunately, my expectations were wrong. Bayswater Inn is an excellent choice for people who aren't planning on spending much time in the hotel, but that doesn't mean that it isn't possible. The staff is nice and helpful and helped us out with a lot of things, such as directions. The rooms that we lived in were very clean and basic (in a good way though). The breakfast was decent, not the best I've had but not the worst either. The location of the hotel is perfect, there are two train-stations a few hundred meters from it, which makes it easy to get to your location of choice without muuch fuss. So, if you need a roof over your head for a week or so and if you aren't picky, then Bayswater Inn is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Poor and deceitful management”
Reviews.Author: chegwin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute for a weekend in London. On arriving the receptionist ignored me to speak to her friend. She then couldn't find our room on the guest list and told us that they didn't have a room for us, despite confirming it on the phone the day before! They ordered a taxi to take us to our new hotel and sent us half way across London to the WRONG hotel, finally ending up 2 hours later at the Park Inn in Lancaster Gate. My recommendation - pay a little extra and stay at the Park Inn instead! Far nicer, cleaner and excellent breakfast. Bayswater Inn is a bitter disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “EVEN IF THIS WAS THE LAST HOTEL ON EARTH DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jo12331
Reviews.Content: I think any one who has rated this hotel higher than 1 out 5 must have come inside 'plants'. By the way I tried to give 0 out of 5 but Trip Advisor insists on 1 at least. Indeed a single pot plant would have been more efficient and helpful than any of the staff we came in to contact with. The room was abismal - completely filthy with ants, mould, and a leaking ceiling. I am now safely back home but still so itchy I have just googled bedbugs and human fleas. With a window that wouldn't open and no air conditioning we borrowed a filthy fan which was caked in so much detritus I was afraid to turn it on - and only needed to give a Â£20 deposit. I read somewhere that this hotel was completely renovated in 2002, 1902 would be closer to the reality.

Reviews.Title: “Classic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: malenykij_polgar
Reviews.Content: Indeed, we were looking for a cheap hotel for a five days stay in London and we wanted to spend more on culture and shopping than on the hotel - this is the reason for the choice. Otherwise, forget it. We chose it according to the price category, the acceptable location and yes, the pictures on the web were attracting. Now we know, that the photographer is an artist. There is no difference to other buildings in this are of London. We realized that the hotel is full of tourists thinking the same way - save your money on accomodation, spend it elsewhere. Getting to your room from the reception makes you seasick. The floor is anything else but even and this style of "architecture" or "engineering" will continue in the room and basicyl everywhere you go in the UK. Parallel lines, straights and right angles were not taught in school in university. All equipment will work - somehow. The beds were terrible, the view - well, it was the view of a wall, being two feet away from the window. Others say we were lucky, basement rooms are even worse. Breakfast: fill your stomach with something, the choice is not big. Staff: tries to be friendly, but they are not professional. All in all: they will offer you bed and bathroom and breakfast, but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-loved Bayswater, but would not recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: glesgagalGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Good points-location is very central, however, despite being situated on Princes Square, it was difficult to get a quiet nights sleep. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby, which made the holiday for us. Facilities in the hotel were disappointing-their ad claims it has a "peaceful coffee shop, restaurant and bar" No coffee shop that I coiuld find-there is one dining area which provided breakfast and doubles as a very lacklustre bar in the evenings. Even this was not open on Saturday (despite being advertised as such) Breakfasts were poor-tea grey coloured, juice watered down and only rolls or toast on offer. Rooms were dated and in need of TLC. Paint peeling, bath chipped, stained carpets! No milk for the two wee teabags provided, except dried milk sachets. Certainly no shampoo on offer. it was also so hot while we were there we could not sleep-windows opened marginally at top of otherwise fixed window. Do not attempt to stay there in summer! Only plus points within hotel iteslf-friendly staff (except one who snapped at us first morning when I asked for toast) and it was kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 3 star hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: magic112
Reviews.Content: We booked a mini break to London with Superbreak through Bath travel this hotel was classed as a 3 star hotel with full english breakfast. The room was badly in need of decoration, the bed sheets were ripped and the bed so uncomfortable that I slept on the floor. The walls were paper thin and we could hear other room doors constantly banging all night. The English breakfast consisted of 1 rash of bacon and 1 egg OR 1 sausage and 1 egg which you had to order!. Fine if your a student and want something basic (but sure theres better out there for the price) def not a place for familys.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Mee36
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Bayswater was for 4 nights on our trip to other countries in europe. Initially we found the hotel room very very small. but keeping in mind the central location of the hotel, it was very convenient . bays wayer inn is just one stop away from london paddington making it easily accessible to central london. the break fast in the hotel s poor but if you pay around 4 pounds, you are given eggs, bacon and sausages. There is arrangement for dinner at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaTosh
Reviews.Content: The room was clearly too small to fit four beds yet there was four uncomfortable beds squashed up together in a tiny room. Breakfast was terrible and very basic. The only good thing about this hotel was the location

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Mika7275
Reviews.Content: Only the location is perfect but everything else is horrible. The first impression was tolerable but it changed very fast. The breakfast must be a joke. Only coffee, tea, toast and marmelade. Maybe this is enough in England but I havenÂ´t got used to eat breakfast like this! The room was untidy and it smelt mould. The shower gave only either very warm or very cold water, nothing between these. And of course the lock of the main door didnÂ´t work. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Lot's of tours and you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: penguin28173
Reviews.Content: We went on a tour with EF Tours- the hotel was beautiful from the outside and the lobby not bad but the rooms were dated and not up to my usual standards. The breakfast was toast and jam, coffee, tea and juice. Our american teenager were a little disappointed. The hotel was over run with tour groups from all over the world many of teenagers not very well behaved. I was traveling with a large group of Girl Scout (most of which were very well behaved). There is a small restraunt/bar where the severs were nice, but the manager (old lady) was not very customer friendly and could not wait for people to leave. This is very centrally located close to the underground. Most local places stop serving food very early and because it is in a residential area the pubs close early. If you are looking for well located budgeted hotel this is the place for you- but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “In London's centre but cheap”
Reviews.Author: RaviMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two days in Bayswater Inn in Feb 2009. It was deep winter and snowing, but the hotel was cozy & comfortable. The room as well as the toilet were too small for the comfort of two of staying in the room. But we managed. The greatest advantage was its location, close to the metro station of Bayswater and walkable distance from Marble Arch, Hyde Park. Going around LOndon with this as our base was very convenient. The breakfast was very frugal and we could have been happy with better food.

Reviews.Title: “Run from this place!”
Reviews.Author: dgala48
Reviews.Content: One star is to much. Bad beds, rooms, breakfast and anything else that could come to mind. The only thing going for it is location. Please check Best Western just down the street. Everything the Bayswater pretends to be. We Stayed via Gateone for four nights. Gateone is reveiwing.

Reviews.Title: “deceptive website, poor value in reality”
Reviews.Author: christasman
Reviews.Content: Barely two star, definitely not 3 as promised on the website. Staying at Bayswater Inn was like sleeping on a ladder in a wonky caravan or hostel. Positive was the good shower and pleasant office staff but we cancelled after a second night on the racks and moved to the much better and cheaper Grand Royal Hotel (or Penbridge Palace) a few streets over.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Budget hotel in wonderful notting hill”
Reviews.Author: TraceyNZ1
Reviews.Content: The location is great as notting hill is a lovely suburb, and next door to kensington. The hotel is very poor. Our room was below ground level, it felt like we were in the basement. The room had 1 tiny window, it was a dark, damp room. The breakfast was ridiculous, breadrolls, tea/coffee, juice. I ordered some srambled eggs one morning as I was hungrey, but it was discusting. Staff unfriendly. Great location, pity about the hotel. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “only good thing is location , awful rooms , service & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pinklady001
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with friends for a weekend of Londons sights .Location was excellent. On arrival checked into our room which was 2 levels below ground, no sunlight , damp smell and we could tocuh the ceiling (at 5ft tall). Insisted on a room change at least on ground level as it was like being in a dungeon !!!! We were asked to vacate the room by 11am the following morning where we were then made wait until 3pm to be given a second room on level 2.. basic but clean and major improvment on first nights stay. Staff were extremly unhelpful and breakfast ??? what breaksfast a roll and tea .. Would never stay again or recommended this hotel it shouldnt even be rated!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic great value little last minute stop over”
Reviews.Author: BristolSorbs
Reviews.Content: we were really pleased with our stay here, a clean, quiet, functional room in a well situated hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: S_C27
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fairly average, room was ok better than we have experienced in london for the price. Overall not bad for the price. one or two of the ladys at the desk were unfriendly and not very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: Cerryberry
Reviews.Content: I had only stayed at this hotel because it was my birthday and I bought tickets to go and see the lion king at the lyceum theatre. The hotel was included as a deal. I didn't think about reading reviews on the hotel before i booked because you would think it would be up to a high stardard as it is linked with a theatre. BUT I WAS VERY WRONG! The service was very poor, We weren't showen to our room. Our room was the last room on the 4th floor. The room was very basic, the toilet seat was all cracked and chipped, the shower looked as old as me! And the beds weren't vey comfortable. Breakfast- continental, there was a bread roll ( that looked like it had seen better days) toast that was so crunchy and cold ( like it had been cooked and left on the side) cups of tea or coffee that tasted over brued,As well as this, you could pay extra for either a egg, sausage or bacon. Which was at a really high cost. It was also twice as hard to get any service because none of the waiters could speak english or understand us. This stay at this hotel really ruined it for me, I was so thankful that i was only staying here for one night. I will be ALOT MORE CAREFUL the next time i choose where to stay in london!!! My one tip is STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “rooms were better than expected, breakfast service was bad”
Reviews.Author: nataliada
Reviews.Content: e (whilst travelling alone). It was pleasantly spacious room, freshly renovated and spotless lean. There was a basic TV, telephone, a kettle and some hairdryer. The heater was adjustable. The wardrobe they had was huge and the bathroom was with the bathtub (I guess they have shower in some other rooms).
